description: Changes in behavior resulting from past experience. The acquisition, maintenance, and elimination of behavior, and the effects of previous experience on responses to new situations.
name: LEARNING

values.comments: Students loved Professor Rescorla, saying that he was able to make difficult material interesting and accessible. Some students were concerned about lack of homework as a way to determine what concepts were important and to practice the uses of those concepts. One student said, “I’ve always felt that the goal of undergraduate education is to teach you how to think and this class has done just that,” while another said this class was “a highlight of their morning.”
